channel.title: Comments on: 15 Must-Know Tips For Perfect Tennis Doubles
channel.description: Your secret weapon on the court.

item.title: By: Adam Golightly
item.dc:creator: Adam Golightly
item.description: I liked what you said about how poaches should be committed to each other and a volley should follow it and be prepared to hit a ball all the time. My dad wants to try and maintain some better tennis matches so that he can play more and he can be better with more practice. He would really like to get some help from a professional so that it is made better and will have the right maintenance for it.
item.content:encoded: I liked what you said about how poaches should be committed to each other and a volley should follow it and be prepared to hit a ball all the time. My dad wants to try and maintain some better tennis matches so that he can play more and he can be better with more practice. He would really like to get some help from a professional so that it is made better and will have the right maintenance for it.

item.title: By: Marie Sturk
item.dc:creator: Marie Sturk
item.description: Helpful I’ll give your tips a try.
item.content:encoded:
Helpful
I’ll give your tips a try.

item.title: By: Derek
item.dc:creator: Derek
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/15-must-know-tips-for-perfect-tennis-doubles/#comment-133">Janet K Cannon</a>.
Usually no, both players should attack the net, and then one player should run back if there is a lob.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Janet K Cannon.

Usually no, both players should attack the net, and then one player should run back if there is a lob.

item.title: By: Kenneth Blair
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Blair
item.description: I liked everything you said except not liking to lob against the wind. Lobbing into the wind is way easier than lobbing with the wind. Not sure what you were trying to say.
item.content:encoded: I liked everything you said except not liking to lob against the wind. Lobbing into the wind is way easier than lobbing with the wind. Not sure what you were trying to say.

item.title: By: PeoplePerProjectCom
item.dc:creator: PeoplePerProjectCom
item.description: What have been the biggest changes in how doubles has been played on the ATP and WTA tours since 1985 when you turned pro?
item.content:encoded: What have been the biggest changes in how doubles has been played on the ATP and WTA tours since 1985 when you turned pro?

item.title: By: Medhyps
item.dc:creator: Medhyps
item.description: The Bryans are so energetic that they’re in motion even between points. During points, they’re in motion even if they’re not the one hitting the shot. They’re constantly moving their feet, trying to anticipate where the next ball is going to go. That is a big lesson for recreational players to learn because that constant movement enables them to get off to a quicker start.
item.content:encoded: The Bryans are so energetic that they’re in motion even between points. During points, they’re in motion even if they’re not the one hitting the shot. They’re constantly moving their feet, trying to anticipate where the next ball is going to go. That is a big lesson for recreational players to learn because that constant movement enables them to get off to a quicker start.

item.title: By: Janet K Cannon
item.dc:creator: Janet K Cannon
item.description:
When playing doubles, should one partner "back up" the other partner in case the first person misses the shot?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
When playing doubles, should one partner “back up” the other partner in case the first person misses the shot?
